title: Add Cursor IDE adapter for Clavain skills and agent dispatch

comments.author: sma
comments.text:
## Context

Clavain is a Claude Code plugin — its skills, agents, and commands use Claude Code conventions (Skill tool invocation, custom subagent_type values like clavain:review:*, /clavain:* slash commands, SessionStart hooks). None of these exist in Cursor.

A proof-of-concept adapter was built and tested in this session (2026-02-09). Two skill files at ~/.cursor/skills-cursor/ successfully translated Clavain agent dispatch to Cursor's Task(generalPurpose) model. The architecture-strategist agent ran in codebase-aware mode and produced a full architectural review of flux-drive P0 beads.

## What the adapter needs

**1. Routing skill** (`adapters/cursor/clavain/SKILL.md`)
- CLAVAIN_ROOT path resolution (auto-detect from plugin cache or local checkout)
- 3-layer routing table (stage/domain/language) from using-clavain
- Agent dispatch translation: clavain:review:* → Task(generalPurpose) + agent .md content as system prompt
- Skill access pattern: Read tool instead of Skill tool
- Supersedes notice for older superpowers/compound-engineering plugins
- Known limitations (no Codex dispatch, no hooks, no Oracle/cross-AI)

**2. Flux-drive wrapper** (`adapters/cursor/clavain-flux-drive/SKILL.md`)
- Phase-by-phase overrides for Cursor environment
- Skip Codex mode detection (always Task dispatch)
- Skip Phase 4 cross-AI (Oracle not available)
- Agent roster quick-reference with relative file paths
- Points to source SKILL.md for orchestration logic

**3. Install script** (`adapters/cursor/install.sh`)
- Copies or symlinks adapter skills into ~/.cursor/skills-cursor/
- Detects CLAVAIN_ROOT (local checkout vs plugin cache)
- Idempotent (safe to re-run)

**4. Optional: additional skill wrappers** for high-value skills
- brainstorming, writing-plans, systematic-debugging, requesting-code-review
- Thin wrappers that read from source, not full copies

## Translation table

| Claude Code | Cursor | Adapter handles |
|---|---|---|
| Skill tool invocation | Read tool on SKILL.md | Routing skill |
| subagent_type: clavain:review:* | Task(generalPurpose) + .md content | Routing skill |
| /clavain:command slash commands | Natural language triggers | Skill descriptions |
| SessionStart hook (context injection) | Always-applied skill | Routing skill |
| PreToolUse hook (autopilot) | Not mappable | Documented as limitation |
| SessionEnd hook (sync) | Not mappable | Documented as limitation |
| MCP servers | Cursor MCP config | User configures separately |

## What was validated

- Agent dispatch via generalPurpose works — agents enter codebase-aware mode and produce specialized reviews
- Skill descriptions with broad trigger phrases enable auto-discovery in Cursor
- Phase files (launch.md, synthesize.md) can be read on demand with no modification
- The adapter is pure markdown — no compiled code, no dependencies

## Open questions

- Should the adapter live in adapters/cursor/ or be a separate repo?
- Should it auto-detect whether it's running in Claude Code vs Cursor and adjust behavior?
- How to handle MCP server configuration (context7, qmd, agent-mail)?
- Should there be a Cursor .mdc rule file in addition to the skills?

title: flux-drive: Merge dual dispatch paths into single launch.md with conditional
description: launch.md (Task dispatch, 178 lines) and launch-codex.md (Codex dispatch, 113 lines) are parallel implementations of the same pipeline with different error handling, path resolution, template vocabulary, and agent bootstrap logic. Codex dispatch is a cost optimization (cheaper models via Codex CLI), not a capability difference — both produce the same output files in the same format. This creates 2x maintenance surface for marginal gain. Fix: fold launch-codex.md into launch.md with a CLODEX_MODE conditional. Keep the Codex-specific bits (dispatch.sh path resolution, Project Agent bootstrap, temp directory management) as a subsection gated on the flag. Shared output format spec, shared error handling, shared completion detection. Source: flux-drive self-review architecture-strategist + fd-code-quality + code-simplicity (3/5 agents, P1).

Questions: (1) what is the actual per-agent token cost with and without trimming? (2) does trimming reduce finding quality (agents miss cross-section issues)? (3) does the 200-line threshold still make sense? Consider removing trimming entirely and measuring impact on cost and quality. If 200K windows make trimming unnecessary for typical documents (500-1000 lines), remove the complexity. Source: flux-drive self-review code-simplicity-reviewer (P2).

flux-drive: Add atomic completion signal for parallel agents
description: File existence is the sole completion predicate for agent output (Step 2.3 + Step 3.0). A partially-written file passes the check — if an agent crashes mid-write, synthesis reads truncated content and either gets malformed YAML or incomplete prose. Two options: (1) atomic write-then-rename — agent writes to {agent-name}.tmp, renames to {agent-name}.md on completion, (2) end-of-file sentinel marker — agent writes '---END---' as last line, synthesis checks for it. Option 1 is more robust but requires agents to use two Write calls. Option 2 is simpler but can be missed by agents. Source: flux-drive self-review concurrency-reviewer + architecture-strategist (P0).

description: Codex dispatch path (phases/launch-codex.md:100-105) has retry logic and fallback. Default Task dispatch path has none — if a background Task agent fails silently, it shows as 'no findings' with no retry. Mirror the Codex path: check for missing findings files, retry once, note failures in synthesis summary.

title: pr-comment-resolver orphan color: blue field
description: agents/workflow/pr-comment-resolver.md has undocumented color: blue frontmatter field. No other agent uses it, not documented in AGENTS.md. Either document or remove.

title: Fix Oracle timeout inconsistency in flux-drive
description: SKILL.md roster specifies 'timeout 300' (5 min) in the Oracle bash command example, but phases/launch.md:49 says 'timeout: 600000' (10 min) for the Bash tool call. These should match — pick one value and use it consistently.

title: P1: Routing table missing 7+ commands and 2 skills
description: - type: bug

title: Merge 4 cross-AI skills into single skill with escalation modes
description: interpeer, prompterpeer, winterpeer, splinterpeer total ~1411 lines and form a strict escalation chain. Each contains duplicate comparison tables. Merge into one cross-ai-review skill with modes: quick/deep/council/mine. Eliminates ~400 lines of duplication. Source: flux-drive P2-5 (2 agents).

title: Strengthen file-write instruction in flux-drive agent prompts
description: Agents spawned via Task(run_in_background: true) may return text to caller instead of writing to OUTPUT_DIR. The 'Write your findings to:' instruction is in the task prompt, not system prompt, and nothing forces agents to use the Write tool. Phase 3 polls OUTPUT_DIR via ls and will time out if files aren't created. Fix: add forceful instruction — 'Your FIRST action must be to use the Write tool to create {OUTPUT_DIR}/{agent-name}.md. All output goes in that file.'

title: P0: agent-native-architecture still has 9 XML tag pairs
P1: Duplicate brainstorming/SKILL.md mapping in upstreams.json
description: - type: bug

title: P1: learnings command duplicates engineering-docs — convert to thin shim
flux-drive: Add user consent gate before auto-chaining to interpeer mine mode
description: Phase 4 Step 4.3 auto-chains to interpeer mine mode when Oracle and Claude agents disagree. This happens without user consent — the user gets pulled into a disagreement resolution flow they didn't ask for. The rest of flux-drive has appropriate consent gates (Step 1.3 approval before launch) but Phase 4 skips this pattern. Fix: add AskUserQuestion before invoking interpeer mine mode. Options: 'Resolve disagreements (interpeer mine)', 'View disagreements only', 'Skip — I'll review the raw findings'. Source: flux-drive self-review fd-user-experience (P1).

title: flux-drive: Add timeout to foreground retry in Step 2.3
description: When a background agent fails and is retried in Step 2.3 (launch.md line 164), the retry uses run_in_background: false with no timeout specified. The retried agent could run indefinitely, blocking synthesis. The Codex dispatch path has timeout: 300000 (5 min) on bootstrap but the Task dispatch retry has nothing. Fix: add explicit timeout guidance — 'Retry with run_in_background: false and timeout: 300000 (5 min). If retry does not complete within timeout, create stub file.' Source: flux-drive self-review concurrency-reviewer (P1).

title: Consolidate 3 resolve-* commands into single /resolve
description: resolve-parallel, resolve-todo-parallel, resolve-pr-parallel share identical 4-step workflow, differ only in input source (grep, files, gh). Merge into one /resolve command with auto-detection or --source flag. Source: flux-drive P1-10 (3 agents agree).

title: flux-drive: Enforce section trimming for token optimization (Phase 2)
/lfg: add test/verification gate before quality-gates
description: /quality-gates says 'run after tests pass' but /lfg doesn't include a hard test gate step. Clodex-mode execution may skip /work which contains continuous testing guidance. Insert explicit verification step before quality-gates: run project test + lint commands and fail fast. Could use verification-before-completion skill. Source: Oracle interpeer deep review Finding 14.

title: Commit 3 uncommitted PRD agents (product-skeptic, strategic-reviewer, user-advocate)
description: 3 PRD agents exist on disk but were never committed. The flux-drive roster (SKILL.md lines 212-214), AGENTS.md, and README.md all reference them, but published plugin v0.4.13 doesn't include them. Anyone installing Clavain gets a roster that references agents that don't exist. Fix: git add and commit the 3 files.

title: /quality-gates: specify diff-driven reviewer context
description: /quality-gates selects agents by file extension but doesn't specify what context agents actually review. Standardize: unified diff (git diff HEAD + git diff --cached), list of changed files with reasons, relevant config if touched. Ask reviewers to reference diff hunks in findings (file:line). Source: Oracle interpeer deep review Finding 16.

title: Assign model: sonnet/haiku to mechanical review agents
description: 28 of 29 agents use model: inherit (Opus-class). Assign model: sonnet to fd-code-quality, fd-user-experience, pattern-recognition-specialist, shell-reviewer, code-simplicity-reviewer, deployment-verification-agent. Assign model: haiku to git-history-analyzer. ~50-60% cost reduction. Source: flux-drive P1-13.

title: Merge Tier 1/3 agent pairs into conditional agents
description: fd-architecture/architecture-strategist, fd-security/security-sentinel, fd-performance/performance-oracle cover same domains at 2 tiers. Merge each pair into one agent that conditionally reads project docs when available. Eliminates 3 agents and ~250 lines. Source: flux-drive P2-4 (code-simplicity).

title: flux-drive: Add basic telemetry to OUTPUT_DIR/meta.json
description: Flux-drive has no telemetry. Can't currently measure: YAML frontmatter compliance rate per agent, finding density (findings per agent) to tune triage scoring, whether 'skip' agents were retroactively needed, whether convergence actually correlates with issue importance, token cost per phase, wall-clock time per agent. Without data, improvements are driven by anecdotal observation. Fix: write a meta.json to OUTPUT_DIR after each flux-drive run containing: (1) run metadata (date, input type, document stem), (2) per-agent: compliance (valid/malformed/missing), finding count, verdict, wall-clock time, (3) triage: agents selected, agents skipped, scoring table, (4) synthesis: convergence counts, dedup stats. This file is cheap to produce (one Write call) and enables data-driven tuning of triage scoring and agent selection over time.

title: Add spec-flow-analyzer to flux-drive roster or remove from scoring example
description: spec-flow-analyzer appears in the PRD scoring example (SKILL.md line 142) but is NOT listed in any roster table (Domain Specialists, Adaptive Reviewers, or Cross-AI). It lives at agents/workflow/spec-flow-analyzer.md with subagent_type clavain:workflow:spec-flow-analyzer. Either add it to the Adaptive Reviewers table or remove from the scoring example to avoid confusion.

title: P1: plan-reviewer.md uses YAML block scalar instead of inline quoted
flux-drive: Default to summary.md for file inputs too, opt-in for inline annotations
description: Currently flux-drive amends the original document with inline annotations (> **Flux Drive** ({agent-name}): finding) for file inputs, and only writes summary.md for directory/repo inputs. This modifies the user's source document, which may not be desired — especially for shared specs, PRDs, or plans checked into git. Fix: default to writing summary.md to OUTPUT_DIR for all input types (file and directory). Make inline annotation of the source file an opt-in behavior — either via a flag (--annotate) or as an option in the Step 1.3 AskUserQuestion confirmation. Source: flux-drive self-review fd-user-experience (P1).

title: fd-* agents: document as flux-drive internals in routing table
description: fd-architecture, fd-security, fd-code-quality, fd-performance, fd-user-experience are flux-drive-scoped Tier 1 agents but appear alongside general reviewers in agent roster. Users may invoke the wrong agent directly. Document fd-* as flux-drive internals (auto-selected by flux-drive, not for direct invocation) or note this clearly in the routing table. Source: Oracle interpeer deep review Finding 9.

title: Clarify document trimming responsibility in flux-drive prompt template
description: phases/launch.md:76-84 Token Optimization block is ambiguous — reads as instruction to the agent but should be work done by the orchestrator before pasting. If flux-drive includes full doc and expects agent to trim, 100% of tokens are sent anyway. Fix: orchestrator trims before pasting, remove the Token Optimization block from agent-facing prompt.

title: Merge claude-automation-recommender into Clavain
description: Pull claude-automation-recommender skill from official claude-code-setup plugin. Analyzes codebases and recommends Claude Code automations (hooks, skills, MCP servers, subagents). Medium value — useful but not core to agent rig.

title: Add /commit thin shim command delegating to landing-a-change
description: docs/plugin-audit.md line 77 notes: 'The /commit shortcut is convenient. Consider adding a thin /commit command to Clavain that delegates to landing-a-change with a just-commit flag.' The disabled commit-commands plugin provided this convenience. A thin /commit command (5-10 lines) that invokes the landing-a-change skill in 'just commit' mode would fill this gap without re-enabling the redundant plugin. Source: plugin-audit.md.

title: Create agent-observability skill
description: Token tracking, error monitoring, cost dashboards for production agent rigs. References agent-mail's observability.md and operations_alignment_checklist.md. Pattern guidance, not tooling.

title: Sanitize GitHub Actions script injection in pr-agent-commands.yml
description: PR comment body interpolated directly into JS template literals via ${{ }} expressions instead of process.env. Affects pr-agent-commands.yml:75,203. Replace with env: + process.env pattern. Source: flux-drive SEC-1 (HIGH).

title: /lfg: reorder so plan-review gates execution, pass plan path to /work
description: Currently /lfg runs: brainstorm → plan → execute → review plan (flux-drive) → code review → quality-gates. Reviewing the plan after executing it is backward. Reorder: brainstorm → write-plan → plan-review (gate) → execute → quality-gates → resolve → ship. Also pass the plan file path from Step 2 into /work in Step 3 so execution isn't ambiguous. Source: Oracle interpeer deep review Findings 12+13.

title: flux-drive: Add model hints for Tier 3 agents (Phase 1)
Split flux-drive SKILL.md into progressive phase files
description: flux-drive at 745 lines/32KB is the largest skill. Contains 4 phases, Codex dispatch (4.5KB dead weight in Task path), and cross-AI escalation. Split into SKILL.md entry point (~2KB) + phases/launch.md + phases/launch-codex.md + phases/synthesize.md + phases/cross-ai.md. Reduces initial load from 32KB to ~2KB. Source: flux-drive P1-12.

title: SessionStart hook: downgrade companions to FYI, fix stderr mixing, portable stat
description: Three hook improvements: (1) Companion detection wrapped in EXTREMELY_IMPORTANT — should be FYI-level, only elevate when actionable. (2) cat SKILL.md 2>&1 mixes stderr into injected content — should fail gracefully with short error note. (3) stat -c is GNU-specific, breaks on macOS/BSD — use portable alternative or fallback. Source: Oracle interpeer deep review Findings 18-20.

title: Fix CLAUDE.md validation comment (28→29) and add Rust to language list
description: CLAUDE.md:17 says Should be 28 but actual agent count is 29. CLAUDE.md:31 lists Go/Python/TypeScript/Shell but omits Rust despite rust-reviewer.md existing. Fix: 2 line edits. Source: flux-drive P0-2, P1-1.

title: Extract concurrency-reviewer code examples to references/ directory
description: concurrency-reviewer.md at 606 lines/20KB has inline Go, Python, TypeScript, Shell, JS examples across 11 sections. Extract to agents/review/references/concurrency-patterns.md. Reduces per-dispatch from ~5000 to ~1500 tokens. Source: flux-drive P2-14 (2 agents).
